jobDescription: Our adventurous client studio in Helsinki is currently seeking a skilled (Senior) Game Developer to join their team. The gig? Formulating innovative game concepts tailor-made for their unique products, with a strong emphasis on movement-based gameplay. From ideation to deployment, you'll be at the helm of projects that promise to inject joy and activity into the lives of players across the globe.
requirements:
3+ years of Unity game development experience.

Passion for game design and development, especially in movement-based gameplay.

Proficiency in C# programming.

Track record of contributing to commercial products.

Strong communication skills.
responsibilities:
Design and implement new game features, emphasizing movement-based mechanics.

Shepherd projects from concept to completion, ensuring engaging player experiences.
benefits:
Join an international team, bringing together diverse perspectives and experiences.

Dive into fun and exciting projects that push the boundaries of gaming innovation.

Work in a cool and inspiring workspace that fosters creativity and collaboration.

jobDescription: Our neighbouring studio in Helsinki is on the lookout for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join their ranks and assist in sculpting the web infrastructure for their dynamic gaming products. In the realm of active gaming, a robust web infrastructure is paramount, and as a Full Stack Developer, you'll play a vital role in shaping the web platform to new heights.
requirements:
Experience with Ruby on Rails.

Familiarity with JavaScript and its libraries (jQuery, React, Angular).

Understanding of HTML, CSS (SASS), and SQL.

Good communication skills.

Knowledge of unit/integration testing.
responsibilities:
Enhance and develop new features for the studio’s web platform

Work across web, mobile, and gaming ecosystems

Ensure quality through unit and integration tests

Utilize Ruby on Rails and ReactJS for web development

Deploy web apps on mobile platforms
benefits:
Join an international team, and work in a cool and inspiring workspace that fosters creativity and collaboration.

You’ll have the opportunity to tackle groundbreaking projects and innovative games, reaching players worldwide.

jobDescription: We're looking for a Senior Tools Programmer with at least 5 years of experience. It's fine if your experience isn't in gaming, but an enthusiasm for games and a desire to dive into the gaming industry are key.
requirements:
Must-have skills:
TypeScript
PixiJS
XState
Electron
HTML/CSS

Bonus skills to master:
AWS
Node.js
GitLab CI
Yarn
Serverless
Gulp
Webpack
Sentry
WebGL
Mocha
responsibilities: This role is all about collaboration, innovation, and working closely with our CTO to develop our backend services and tools.
benefits:
Joining Quicksave Interactive means being part of a growing startup poised to make waves in the gaming and tools market. We value transparency and offer a glimpse into the entire startup journey.

1. Flexible Work Environment: Our approach supports hybrid and remote workstyles, with online meetings accommodating all. For those in the Helsinki area, bi-weekly team lunches provide a chance to connect in person.

2. Competitive Compensation: Expect a competitive salary along with comprehensive healthcare coverage.

3. Quarterly Team Events: Every quarter, we bring everyone together for fun and active team events. It's a great time to unwind and bond with the team.

4. Lunch Benefit: Enjoy a lunch benefit that makes daily meals convenient and enjoyable.

5. Modern Office: Work in a beautiful office space located in the heart of Helsinki Design District, designed to inspire creativity and collaboration.

6. Relocation Support: For those moving to join us, we provide relocation services and assistance to make your transition as smooth as possible.

jobDescription:
We are BoomBit, a leading Mobile Gaming company with a global audience of millions of players and over 1 billion downloads of our games since our inception in 2010. Our main games from the BoomBit Group include Hunt Royale, Dancing Line and Ramp Car Jumping. We’re a game developer and a publisher. With over 320 employees, we cover games of nearly any genre in the free-to-play (F2P) model on iOS and Android, and also on the Nintendo Switch. 

We have experts across publishing, user interface/experience (UI/UX), game design, monetisation, user acquisition (UA), creative, business intelligence (BI), quality assurance (QA), LiveOps, art and game development spread across and are continually looking to strengthen our team.

Why should you apply?
 
- Competitive salary based on experience and skills
- Stable employment condition
- Flexible working hours! Start between 7 and 10 AM – it's your call
- Work tools provided – Computer/Monitor – everything to help you succeed
- A modern, non-corporate work culture with fun, creative people who make your job more enjoyable
- Direct communication with supervisors
- International team with expertise from around the Mobile Games Industry
- A creative environment that encourages knowledge-sharing
- Possibilities to improve your skills, e.g., internal workshops and training programs
- Nice office in Gdańsk with garden, place for bicycles, with shower and fully equipped kitchen
- Many opportunities to integrate with others: board games evenings, LAN parties, BBQ at the office during summer, and more
- Quarterly Team building events (optional) – an excellent way for you and your team members to bond
- Certified Employer by Great Place to Work
requirements:
- Proven experience in a senior publishing role within the gaming industry
- In-depth knowledge of PC and console platforms, market trends, and player behavior
- Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
- Strong negotiation and relationship management skills
- Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities
- Demonstrated success in launching and managing successful games on PC and consoles
- Effective communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally
- Independence in problem solving
- Ability to manage projects on time and on budget
- Good work organization
- Communication skills
- Flexible mindset
responsibilities:
- Co-create and execute publishing strategy for the PC and console’s portfolio
- Manage PC and consoles games’ portfolio
- Create and execute digital pricing and bundle policy
- Create and execute retail policy
- Secure distribution deals and be in direct contact with the platform owner
- Plan and execute marketing activities, including user acquisition, reviews, PR, events, and advertising
- Oversee the development of new games and be in touch with product owners
- Manage and plan publishing budget and roadmap
- Build relationships with key stakeholders, developers, marketing agencies, and platform owners
- Lead a high-performance team handling all aspects of PC and console game publishing, from strategy to product management
- Build and curate a portfolio of top-tier, commercially successful PC and console games
- Cultivate strong relationships with game developers, marketing partners, platform holders, and influencers
- Monitor and analyze financial performance, making data-driven decisions to maximize ROI
- Analyze the market and implement best practices in marketing and publishing strategies
- Maintain close cooperation with the head of the business development & investments

jobDescription:
It’s a really exciting time to be at Space Ape Games. We’ve created a fast-paced environment that promotes genuine autonomy and we have projects at all stages of the development cycle. We launched our hit music game, , in 2021 and we’re following its success with  less than two years later. We also officially launched our first puzzle game in July, , and we’re preparing to scale this game to global success. On top of all this, we’re running several mature live games and working on some exciting new projects behind the scenes!

We seek a passionate, talented, creative producer to help with all aspects of art production and development. Working across a wide portfolio of new, in-development and live titles, you will be responsible for content pipelines, schedules and building key relationships with external partners. Alongside the Studio Art Director, you will be crucial in maintaining a healthy art culture and artists' personal development, growth and well-being.
requirements:
5+ years as a producer, project management or equivalent experience
Experience in supervising production pipelines
Solid understanding of creative pipelines, approval processes, and dependency chains.
Strong organisational skills and attention to detail
Self-starter - Someone who can approach challenges creatively and see things through to their final resolution
Ability to build, track, and maintain feature and content schedules
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Familiar with Scrum, Kanban, and Waterfall project management methodologies
Be able to give feedback internally and externally in a professional manner
responsibilities:
The building and maintaining of art production pipelines, both internally and with our external teams
To find new art production partners, coordinate with existing collaborators and take on prominent aspects of partner management from contract negotiations
Facilitate the art production schedules - partnering with art, product and marketing teams to define the scope and verify all asset requests are scheduled
Provide transparency on art production status and communicate frequently with the rest of the production team/leads on asset status, risks, and problem-solving opportunities
Schedule team meetings and run art reviews (as well as in-game content reviews) while providing actionable notes and follow-up info to attendees
Provide mentorship of artists, helping set goals and providing feedback
Motivate and provide support to the art team, contributing to a positive environment and culture through organising training, events and the improvement of existing rituals
Facilitate communication, organisation, processes and pipelines across art disciplines

jobDescription:
Our client Valo Motion is looking for a (Senior) Game Developer to join their team of professionals. While working as a Game Developer at Valo Motion, you will be creating and implementing unique game concepts for Valo Motion’s products. You will work with a highly passionate and motivated team to design, develop, deliver and maintain unique games and products that have not existed before.

Valo Motion offers job possibilities that allow working with larger concepts, platforms and full games. Having full control over their own product platforms and remote software deployment ensures that the games that they develop will always end up to players. They provide a possibility for challenging and inspiring work with unique products that make a difference in the world by making people active. Valo Motion is looking for a Game Developer to join their family of enthusiasts who want to provide joy and thrill of movement to players around the globe.
requirements:
- 3+ years of experience working with the Unity game engine
- Passion for game design and development
- Excellent knowledge of C#
- Experience working on commercial products
- Good communication skills
​
Pluses
- Knowledge of AR technologies
- Experience with Kinect or movement based games
- Sports/exergame background
- Knowledge of UI/UX design
responsibilities:
- Designing and implementing (rapid prototyping) new game features and interactions
​- Taking a game project from the concept stage to the finish line

jobDescription: Our client, Magic Do As You Will, is a well-funded, venture-backed gaming startup of 18 and they are looking for a highly experienced Lead Product Manager with F2P casual or hyper-casual experience to help them build games that are unique, exciting and with lots of heart!
requirements:
- 5+ years of experience in product for F2P mobile games, preferably casual, hybrid-casual or hyper-casual.
- Love for the startup environment, working in small teams, iterating quickly, wearing multiple hats.
- Proven track record of successfully developing, launching and managing digital products
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Non-violent communication
responsibilities:
- Lead the development & live ops of a new & exciting hybrid casual game. Define a clear product vision, strategy, and roadmap for the game.
- Work directly with the CEO and Head of Game Dev. maximizing revenue potential across all games' channels.
- Wear multiple hats as the team iterates and moves at lightspeed.
- Take overall lead on game growth and set direction for Game improvements, Live Ops and UA.
Lead go-to-market.
- Together with the Analytics team, monitor monetization, game economy, player engagement, and other significant metrics.
- Put a strategy in action - Lead proofs-of-concept, working closely with multi-disciplinary development teams to create “product-market fit”.
- Create constant live events that will drive further engagement and monetization.
- Define in-game sales, offers, and promotions to maximize conversion rate and ARPPU.
